title.narrative: Improving the Greek Reception System through Site Management Support and Targeted Interventions in Long Term Accommodation Sites

description.narrative: In response to the ongoing emergency situation in Greece, IOM supports the Government of Greece in the daily management of all long-term accommodation sites operation in the country by providing Site Management Support assistance (SMS) in order to ensure dignified and harmonized reception and protection standards. In order to adequately respond to the needs and challenges identified in the country, multi-sectoral teams are deployed in each site to ensure dignified living conditions and facilitate the day-to-day management of the sites by performing essential SMS activities (i,e. reception procedures, information management, care and maintenance, accountability mechanisms); to mitigate risks and ensure protection of vulnerable groups by monitoring protection standards, preventing harm and providing direct assistance and case management to identified cases requiring specialized treatment; to ensure access of the migrant population to quality education by offering Non-Formal Education opportunities (NFE). Interventions are developed and implemented in partnership with SMS agencies (Danish Refugee Council Greece (DRC Greece), Arbeiter Samariter Bund (ASB) and European Expression) or specialized protection actors (UNICEF, ARSIS, Greek Council for Refugees (GCR)).
